snippet: Leaders of the agency said the financial benefits it would reap from the deal, which is meant to entice Rupert Murdoch to move his two corporations into 2 World Trade Center, would outweigh the costs.
abstract: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey commissioners agree on deal to reduce proposed rent Rupert Murdoch-owned 21st Century Fox and News Corporation would pay at World Trade Center by $144 million; reduction would be accomplished in part by authority providing part of rent subsidy, which breaks pledge its board made in 2010.
lead_paragraph: Leaders of the agency said the financial benefits it would reap from the deal, which is meant to entice Rupert Murdoch to move his two corporations into 2 World Trade Center, would outweigh the costs.

headline.main: Port Authority to Pay Part of Murdoch Companies’ Rent to Lure Them Downtown
headline.print_headline: Port Agency Backs Deal on Rent to Get Murdoch

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Port Authority of New York and New Jersey
